results.title: Nurse Charged With Murder of Two Patients by Lethal Insulin Doses
results.abstract: The North Carolina nurse, Johnathan Hayes, was also charged with attempted murder over the injection of a third woman who survived, the Forsyth County district attorney said.

media.caption: Johnathan Hayes was a nurse at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist in Winston-Salem, N.C.

results.byline: By Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch
results.title: Elon Musk Completes $44 Billion Deal to Own Twitter
results.abstract: The world’s richest man closed his blockbuster purchase of the social media service, thrusting Twitter into a new era.

media.caption: Elon Musk agreed to buy Twitter for $44 billion in April.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Schumer, Charles E;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party
results.title: Schumer Caught on Mic Forecasting Democrats’ Midterm Races
results.abstract: Relief at John Fetterman’s debate and the Pennsylvania Senate race, alarm at Herschel Walker’s standing in Georgia.

media.caption: Senator Chuck Schumer and President Biden met at the Syracuse airport on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Debates (Political);Polls and Public Opinion;Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Pennsylvania
results.byline: By Katie Glueck and Alyce McFadden
results.title: Pennsylvania Voters Absorb an Unusual Debate: ‘I Felt Sorry for Fetterman’
results.abstract: In interviews, Democrats and Republicans had a range of reactions to the state’s Senate debate, including alarm, protectiveness, empathy and worry about the political implications.

media.caption: “I felt sorry for Fetterman,” said Deb Donahue, 68, a registered Republican and a Mehmet Oz supporter from Camp Hill, Pa. “I think he really struggled a little bit.”
media.copyright: Amanda Mustard for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: News and News Media;Freedom of the Press;Classified Information and State Secrets;News Sources, Confidential Status of;United States Politics and Government;Newspapers;Garland, Merrick B;Justice Department
results.title: Garland Formally Bars Justice Dept. From Seizing Reporters’ Records
results.abstract: The rule codifies and expands a policy he issued in 2021, after it came to light that the Trump administration had secretly gone after records of reporters for The Times, The Washington Post and CNN.

media.caption: The changes, Attorney General Merrick B. Garland said, “recognize the crucial role that a free and independent press plays in our democracy.”
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Research;Paxlovid (Drug);Immune System;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Disease Rates;Coughs;Journal of the American Medical Assn;JAMA Network Open
results.title: Covid-19 Symptoms Can Rebound Even if You Don’t Take Paxlovid
results.abstract: A new study found that more than a third of those who recovered from an infection had symptoms recur days or weeks later.
org_facet: Journal of the American Medical Assn

media.caption: Rebound symptoms are common, said one doctor. “It doesn’t mean that things are going south,” he said. “It’s just the natural way the disease goes.”

results.adx_keywords: Depression (Mental);Dating and Relationships;Marriages;Mental Health and Disorders
results.title: How to Help a Partner Living With Depression
results.abstract: Whether they are coping with seasonal symptoms or chronic depression, here’s how to offer love and understanding while still caring for yourself.

results.title: Is New York (of All Places) About to Go Red?
results.abstract: Two weeks before Election Day, races across the state have gotten too close for Democrats’ comfort.

results.title: More Than 100 N.Y.C. Middle Schools Will Drop Selective Screens
results.abstract: Local districts decided whether to allow middle schools to use grades in choosing students. The majority chose to keep a less competitive lottery system that began during the pandemic.

media.caption: Intermediate School 238 in Hollis, Queens, is in one of just two districts that will increase the number of middle schools using screened admissions.
media.copyright: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times

results.byline: By Isabella Kwai and Emma Bubola
results.title: Dutch Are Investigating Reported Illegal Chinese Police Stations
results.abstract: Reports by news media and a human rights group say Chinese police forces opened two offices in the Netherlands that are used to intimidate Chinese citizens.

media.caption: The China embassy in The Hague. Dutch authorities are investigating reports that other Chinese-run offices are intimidating Chinese nationals.

results.adx_keywords: Art;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Museums;Monet, Claude;van Gogh, Vincent;Vermeer, Jan;Just Stop Oil;Mauritshuis;Hague (Netherlands);London (England);Germany
results.title: Climate Protester Glues His Head to ‘Girl With a Pearl Earring’ Painting
results.abstract: The artwork by Johannes Vermeer, exhibited in The Hague, was the latest artwork to be targeted by protesters concerned about climate change. One person glued his head to the painting and another glued his hand to the wall.

media.caption: Johannes Vermeer’s painting “Girl with a Pearl Earring” joins Vincent van Gogh’s “Sunflowers” and Claude Monet’s “Grainstacks” as paintings targeted by climate activists.
media.copyright: Lex Van Lieshout/Agence France-Presse, via Anp/Afp Via Getty Images

results.byline: By Tracey Tully, Benjamin Weiser and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Senator Robert Menendez Faces a New Federal Investigation
results.abstract: The inquiry comes five years after the Justice Department dropped its corruption case against Mr. Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat.

media.caption: In 2015, Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey was indicted on bribery charges. The case ended in a mistrial.

results.title: Texas Goes Permitless on Guns, and Police Face an Armed Public
results.abstract: A new law allowing people to carry handguns without a license has led to more spontaneous shootings, many in law enforcement say.

media.caption: Texas is the most populous state to do away with handgun permit requirements.
media.copyright: Matthew Busch for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Disabilities;United States Politics and Government;Debates (Political);Fetterman, John (1969- );Pennsylvania
results.title: How People With Disabilities Saw Fetterman’s Debate Performance
results.abstract: One in four Americans has a disability, but disabled politicians are rarely on the national debate stage. That made John Fetterman’s appearance a powerful moment, but public reactions were painful.

media.caption: Preparations for Tuesday’s Senate debate in Pennsylvania. Lt. Gov. John Fetterman faced his Republican opponent, Dr. Mehmet Oz, months after a stroke left Mr. Fetterman with an auditory processing disorder.

results.title: What to Know About the Pine-Sol Recall
results.abstract: Clorox is voluntarily recalling tens of millions of bottles of scented Pine-Sol cleaning products that may be contaminated with bacteria.

media.caption: The recalled products include Pine-Sol Scented Multi-Surface Cleaners, in Lavender Clean, Sparkling Wave and Lemon Fresh scents.

results.abstract: The news organization said it had fired the person who posted “vile and reprehensible” tweets and headlines.

results.title: Why Russia Stole Potemkin’s Bones From Ukraine
results.abstract: The 18th-century military commander and lover of Catherine the Great helped conquer Ukraine and looms large in the version of history the Kremlin uses to justify the war.

results.adx_keywords: Mars (Planet);Meteors and Meteorites;Mars InSight (Spacecraft);Earthquakes;Geology;Space and Astronomy;Research;National Aeronautics and Space Administration;Science (Journal);Nature Astronomy (Journal)
results.title: Something Violently Shook the Surface of Mars. It Came From Space.
results.abstract: Scientists thought the InSight spacecraft had recorded some major marsquakes, but with another NASA mission’s help, they found what had really shaken up the red planet.

media.caption: The white spots are water ice that was kicked up by a meteor impact on Mars last December. The crater is about 500 feet wide.
